public class Planef
extends java.lang.Object

Constructor Summary
Planef()
          Creates a plane in the origin with a normal pointing to the positive z-axis
Planef(Linef theFirstLine, Linef theSecondLine)
          Creates a plane defined by two lines.
Planef(Vector3f theOrigin)
          Creates a plane in theOrigin with a normal pointing in the direction of the theOrigin
Planef(Vector3f theOrigin, Vector3f theNormal)
          Creates a plane in theOrigin and its normal
Planef(Vector3f theOrigin, Vector3f thePointA, Vector3f thePointB)
          Creates a plane in theOrigin and two other points in that plane
 
Method Summary
 float angle(Linef line)
          returns the angle in rad between the specified line and this plane
 float getDistance(Vector3f point)
          returns the shortest distance of the specified point to this plane the distance is positive if the point lies on that side of the plane where its normal is pointing to. otherwise its negative.
 Vector3f getIntersection(Linef line)
          returns the intersection point of the specified line with this plane
 Linef getIntersection(Planef thePlane)
          returns the intersection line of the specified plane with this plane

 float getP()
          returns the planes p-value

Planef

public Planef(Linef theFirstLine,
              Linef theSecondLine)
Creates a plane defined by two lines. If the lines don't intersect each other, then the origin of the plane will lie in the middle between the two lines origins

Parameters:
theFirstLine -
theSecondLine -

getOrigin

public Vector3f getOrigin()
returns the origin point of this plane. Its not necessary the one specified when this plane was constructed. Its the result of this planes normal-vector scaled with factor p

Returns:
Vector3f origin point

Vector3f intersection point. returns null if line is parallel to plane

getDistance

public float getDistance(Vector3f point)
returns the shortest distance of the specified point to this plane the distance is positive if the point lies on that side of the plane where its normal is pointing to. otherwise its negative.

Parameters:
point - point
Returns:
float direct distance to this point.
